items.description:
Apologies for being a bit late with the newsletter this week but I'm sure you understand time crunches heading into the holiday season.

This year has been very challenging for me and no doubt for lots of us around the world. As we head towards the holiday season I hope we can all take a moment to reflect on some of the positive parts of the year. And celebrate the upcoming new year. But mostly I want to take a moment to say a big thankyou for joining us in the Weekly Xamarin newsletter.

And as always thankyou to all the amazing Xamarin Community authors who are putting out content for the love of it.

Have a happy holiday season.

‚ù§

Kym

And as always thankyou to all the amazing Xamarin Community authors who are putting out content for the love of it.

Have a happy holiday season.

‚ù§

Kym

items.title: AndroidX with Telerik UI for Xamarin
items.description:
What is AndroidX? Based on the Android documentation: ‚ÄúAndroidX is a major improvement to the original Android Support Library, which is no longer maintained. AndroidX packages fully replace the Support Library by providing feature parity and new libraries.

AndroidX with Telerik UI for Xamarin by Dobrinka Yordanova
items.description_markdown:
What is AndroidX? Based on the Android documentation: ‚ÄúAndroidX is a major improvement to the original Android Support Library, which is no longer maintained. AndroidX packages fully replace the Support Library by providing feature parity and new libraries.

items.description:

items.title: Understanding Multi-Binding in Xamarin Forms
items.description:
Multi-binding is a great feature that was introduced in Xamarin Forms 4.7 that allows the binding of multiple sources to a single target property. It gives us a lot of flexibility as now we don‚Äôt need to create multiple UI elements for each bindable property, which improves performance and makes our code cleaner.

Understanding Multi-Binding in Xamarin Forms by Charlin Agramonte
items.description_markdown:
Multi-binding is a great feature that was introduced in Xamarin Forms 4.7 that allows the binding of multiple sources to a single target property. It gives us a lot of flexibility as now we don‚Äôt need to create multiple UI elements for each bindable property, which improves performance and makes our code cleaner.

[**Understanding Multi-Binding in Xamarin Forms**](https://xamgirl.com/understanding-multi-binding-in-xamarin-forms/) by [Charlin Agramonte](https://twitter.com/chard003)

items.title: DataTemplateSelectors in Xamarin.Forms
items.description:

items.title: Three ways to Fix broken Icon Font in Xamarin App

items.title: Xamarin Podcast American Airlines
items.description:
